page.title: 02Mobile vans
page.content: Many mobile shops visit Sywell. The freezavan comes around once a month with frozen food. Fish and meat vans come every Thursday. The library van also calls on Thursday mornings for people to choose books instead of travelling to Northampton. The Midland Bank comes Wednesday and parks in the pub car park! Three dairies deliver milk daily - Coop, Northern Dairies, and the local Cogenhoe Dairy. Newspapers are delivered daily and each house receives a free copy of The Post and the Mercury and Herald. There is a monthly Church magazine. The Avon lady comes monthly selling make-up and the Kleeneze lady brings a book to choose things like brooms and brushes. Children's Welfare comes each month to weigh babies. There is no Doctor or Dentist Surgery; police, fire, or ambulance station in the village.
